page.title: 05CRUDWELL VILLAGE HALL
page.content: {Crudwell village hall}used to be a chapel.There are four old graves next to it in the long grass.The site was purchased in the 1920's by members of two local families and{given to the {villagers to use for a meeting place. It is easy to find as there is a sign outside which says Crudwell Village Hall.Inside there are toilets, a kitchen and a large hall with a stage. In the backyard there is a shed where the cubs and scouts keep their camping equipment.The{playgroup}is held in the hall on three mornings each week.Their many toys are stored under the stage. Other regular users include{cubs, {scouts,ballet and the Parish Council. Sometimes the brownies hire the hall for a disco or competition.Private parties and discos also take place from time to time.
